title: Infowars Could Shut Down If Alex Jones Joins Bankruptcy, Lawyers Say
sub_head: Lawyers for Infowars’ parent company and Alex Jones defended putting some affiliates in chapter 11 and said their clients would likely be unable to cover potential Sandy Hook judgments if the business shuts down
body:
Alex Jones’s conspiracy website Infowars could go out of business if he or the site’s parent company joined corporate affiliates in bankruptcy, their lawyers said Friday.
Mr. Jones and Infowars’ parent company, Free Speech Systems LLC, “could not operate a business” if they joined the site’s affiliates in bankruptcy, Mr. Jones’s lawyer, Shelby Jordan, said at a hearing in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Victoria, Texas. That would hurt Sandy Hook families who have sued Mr. Jones for falsely claiming the 2012 shooting was a hoax...
